column4: is there a way from the cmd line to find out the temp of my processor? Perhaps cat /proc/<something>/<something> sort of thing?
the temp?
yes the temp
ohh temperature duh
as in the temperature
cat /proc/acpi/thermal_zone/*
thats if yer machine supports acpi
there's nothing in that directory, although the directory does exist. How did you find that, BTW?
just remembered that I was setting up my acpi thermal sensor in the panel
what does /proc/acpi contain?
some files and directories...wading through them now...
cat /proc/acpi/thermal_zone/*/* should give ya everything there
then acpi isnt configured properly to read all those variables
whats in /proc/acpi? anything
pretty decent pc or old clunker?
old clunker. 1.5 Gz PIV made for Win98.
that might be why the acpi might not be reading well
the mobo might support acpi but might have to load and mod stuff for the kernel
I think I just won't worry about it for now. Next time I am in the room w/ the box I'll make sure the fans are spinning.
whats the BIOS say? if the temp is normal there, dont worry
the computer is housed in an area that's hard for me to get to. But I'll have to take a trip there tomorrow or something...
oh ok
